definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: But there are three golden principles.
sentences.chinese: 但其中有三條金科玉律。

sentences.english: Eating fruit is regarded as the golden rule and precious percept after a meal, but physicians put forward the objection.
sentences.chinese: 飯後一隻果被奉爲金科玉律，但醫學家卻提出了異議。

sentences.english: Government contractors’ golden rule is meet the specifications.
sentences.chinese: 政府承包商的金科玉律是符合參數要求。

sentences.english: In fact, Buffett's investment success has three golden rules.
sentences.chinese: 其實，巴菲特投資成功有三條金科玉律。

sentences.english: The old sea captain regarded his bowditch as his bible.
sentences.chinese: 老船長把他那本波迪奇航海手冊奉爲金科玉律。

sentences.english: The first rule of real estate is just as applicable to first dates.
sentences.chinese: 房地產的金科玉律對你的初次約會來說同樣適用。

sentences.english: “There is no golden rule that says how much a market should go down, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼金科玉律規定股市應該跌去多少“。

definition: to take as a guiding principle (idiom)
appropriate to any place and any time (idiom); universally applicable/a panacea
pinyin: fang4 zhi1 si4 hai3 er2 jie1 zhun3

definition: scientific law (e.g. law of conservation of energy)/(in human affairs) a generalization based on observation (e.g. "power corrupts")
the one and only way/the only proper course to take
